web platform tests

'Iâ€™ve Been Doing Blockquotes Wrong' â€” If you skipped past HTML for People above because youâ€™re an HTML expert, Michelleâ€™s moment of reflection around the blockquote element might make you pause for thought. HTML is hard, she notes, not least because itâ€™s both easy and relatively safe to write bad HTML (unlike with badÂ JavaScript).

Beyond some mud slinging (and disappearing blog posts), the biggest news is likely the forced removal of the Advanced Custom Fields plugin from the WordPressÂ directory.

Motion Canvas

Artur BieÅ„

DUFU

Color Thief: Grab Color Palettes from Images in JavaScript â€” Given an image, this uses canvas to return a list of the dominantÂ colors.

items.content:
ğŸš€ Frontend Focus

#â€‹663 â€” October 9, 2024 | Read on the web

CSS Nesting Improves with CSSNestedDeclarations â€” CSSNestedDeclarations is a new, CSS Working Group approved interface to fix some quirks of CSS nesting, such as declarations that come after style rules confusingly shifting up. Itâ€™s in Chrome from v130, and testing is underway in Firefox and Safari. Bramus shares a quick behind-the-scenesÂ here but in short: "This means that CSS nesting got a whole lot better as of Chrome 130."

Bramus Van Damme (Google)

Uh-oh, .io?Â The Disappearance of an Internet Domain? â€” The British government recently announced it was transferring sovereignty of the Chagos Islands to Mauritius. But how can geopolitics alter digital infrastructure? The decision may result in the loss of one of the tech and gaming industryâ€™s much-loved (though problematic) top-level domains: .io.

Gareth Edwards

The First Newsletter Dedicated to ProductÂ Engineers â€” The fastest growing startups increasingly rely on product engineers. These are engineers with the skills to figure out what to build. Product for Engineers is dedicated to sharing the skills and strategies needed to succeed in thisÂ role.

PostHog sponsor

"Automattic is Doing Open Source Dirty" â€” DHH (of Ruby on Rails fame) chimes in on the ongoing WordPress saga, which seems to show no sign of abating soon. He states a concern â€œabout the integrity of open source licensesâ€, adding that such â€œintegrity is under direct assault by Automatticâ€™s grotesque claim for WP Engineâ€™sÂ revenuesâ€. Matt Mullenweg of WordPress replied on X.

The HTTP QUERY Method â€” A draft spec for a new QUERY HTTP method, a â€œsafe, idempotent request method that can carry request contentâ€. Itâ€™s said to be desirable â€œwhen the data conveyed in a request is too voluminous to be encoded into the requestâ€™sÂ URIâ€. It's not quite GET, but it's not quiteÂ POST..

Reschke, Malhotra, Snell, Bishop

Build a Native App Experience with PWAs â€” Join Maximiliano Firtman for a detailed video course exploring how to create installable, offline-capable web apps. You'll learn how to create impressive Progressive Web Apps, explore various UI techniques, dig into how best to test and debug, and how to deploy your efforts to endÂ users.

Frontend Masters sponsor

Web Components Are Okay â€” Spent any time on social this week? You may have spotted many in the frontend community talking about and questioning the overall merit and utility of Web Components. Nolan ties a few of these arguments together, concluding that folks are generally â€œtalking past each other because theyâ€™re building different things with differentÂ constraintsâ€.

Nolan Lawson

CSS Masonry & CSS Grid â€” As mentioned last week, steam is picking up on a formal CSS solution for masonry layouts, but with two competing proposals and lots of various opinions on both flying around, itâ€™s good to take a high-level overview of where things stand â€” thatâ€™s what thisÂ is.

Geoff Graham

Chris Coyier

Preethi Sam

â–¶Â Â Fundamentals of Frontend Architecture â€” A free video course that covers â€œeverything you need to know to build robust and scalable frontend applicationsâ€. It covers architectural drivers, documentation, decision making, prototyping, implementation, andÂ more.

Maxi Ferreira

SVG Coding Examples: Useful Recipes for Writing Vectors byÂ Hand â€” Explores the basics of hand-coding SVGs, how to leverage JavaScript along the way, plus practical examples to demystify the inner workings of common SVGÂ elements.

Myriam Frisano

WorkOS: Start Selling to Enterprises with Just a Few Lines ofÂ Code â€” A modern B2B SaaS identity platform with APIs for SSO, SCIM, RBAC. Trusted by topÂ startups.

Four Tips for Unlocking the Benefits of Svelte in Frontend Development

Why I Prefer WebStorm Over Visual Studio Code for Web Development
Rob Bell

CrUX Vis â€” A new, experimental, browser-based Chrome User Experience Report (CrUX) tool to allow you to visualize CrUX History APIÂ data. This related blog post from Matt Zeunert explains what it does in more detail.

Jamison O'Keefe

Eleventy v3.0 Is Now Available â€” A popular Node.js-based static site generator. This release is written in ESM with full ESM support, is 20% smaller, has 11% fewer dependencies, and installsÂ faster. The Eleventy Image utility hit v5 too.

Zach Leatherman

tailwind-to-inline: A Tailwind CSS to Inline Styles Converter â€” The target use case is email template creation. Quickly craft the templates using Tailwind CSS, but then inline everything for the finalÂ version.

Vardan Hakobyan

OctoPalm.js: A Lightweight JavaScript Utility to Add Customizable Search Functionality to Your Apps â€” Includes features like animated results, customizable scrollbars for lengthy search lists, and real-time results as the userÂ types.

Eddie Gulay

TinyJS: A Lightweight Library to Easily Generate and Customize DOM Elements â€” Includes a jQuery-like syntax for element selection, iteration, and appending content and adding properties to elements. Nothing you couldnâ€™t do with vanilla JS, but a much simplerÂ API.
